technical_features.source_sentence: CELS-patterned QLEDs show remarkable external quantum efficiencies (19.1%, 17.5%, 12.0% for red, green, blue, respectively).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show remarkable external quantum efficiencies (19.1%, 17.5%, 12.0% for red, green, blue, respectively).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show remarkable external quantum efficiencies (19.1%, 17.5%, 12.0% for red, green, blue, respectively).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show a long operation lifetime (T95 at 1000 nits up to 8700 h).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show a long operation lifetime (T95 at 1000 nits up to 8700 h).
CELS-patterned QLEDs show a long operation lifetime (T95 at 1000 nits up to 8700 h).
The patterned QD films maintain approximate to 75% of original PLQY.
Various fluorescence and electroluminescence patterns with a feature size down to approximate to 1.5 μm are demonstrated.
CELS uses a small amount (∼2 wt %) of light-sensitive triphenylmethyl chloride (TPCl) or similar chemicals as additives to QD films.
XPS analysis shows that the molar ratio of Cl and Zn atoms (Cl/Zn) on the QD surfaces is 0.19.
The ligand coverage was about 3.4 nm⁻² [...] The resultant ligand coverage (∼2.0 nm⁻²) was substantially lower.
Typical UV doses for CELS are among 50−500 mJ cm⁻².

qualitative_insights.main_objective: Develop a light-triggered carbocation-enabled ligand stripping (CELS) method for high-resolution quantum dot patterning while maintaining efficiency and stability in QLEDs
key_methodology_summary: UV-triggered TPCl photodissociation into carbocations (TP+) and chloride ions (Cl⁻)
Ligand stripping via TP+ electrophilic reactions
In situ surface defect passivation by Cl⁻
Photoresist-free patterning with developer solvent removal
limitations_discussed_by_authors: Blue QLEDs showed lower PLQY retention (62%)
Potential surface damage from free radicals during ligand exchange
future_work_suggested_by_authors: Develop improved photosensitive chemicals with enhanced patterning capabilities
Integration with optimized QD materials and device architectures
Extension to other nanocrystal systems beyond QDs
novelty_significance_claim: First patterning method matching non-patterned QLED performance
Dual-function photochemistry: ligand stripping + defect passivation
key_tables_figures_present: Figure 4: PLQY retention and photostability data
Table S1: Benchmarking against existing patterning methods
